body:
Comment 5 by **BigBoss1964**: 
I experienced GNU make crashing at lib9 but that isn't related to the env.bash issue, so
much as a MinGW/GNU issue. At least, somehow I doubt fixing MinGW/GNU Make has anything
to do with Go. Building from a path with spaces in it was intentional, to see whether or
not it would work ;).


Also while don't use spaces in pathnames is the golden rule of programming, using double
quotes on environment variables you want used as one word is also the golden rule of
unix sh programming-doesn't take a Wizard to figure it out either.
